revised_title: Regeneration and Feeding Mechanisms in Procerastea
tldr: The author studied the regeneration and feeding behavior of the syllid worm Procerastea, which lives inside membranous tubes built along the stems of the hydroid Syncoryne. They discovered that the worm feeds by pumping out the contents of the hydroid's gastral cavity, using its pharynx and proventriculus as a quick-acting pump. This feeding method allows the worm to obtain a constant supply of food without harming the hydroid, which grows vigorously despite the worm's presence.
